section.name: Configuration
section.p: Configuring Resiste is not that difficult. This page documents everything you need to do.

section.name: JRE
section.p: Resiste requires Java 8. The Windows and Linux downloads come embedded with a Java 8 JRE, so Resiste does not depend on the system-level JRE to run.
However, if you want to override the JRE that comes embedded with Resiste, you can do so by editing, in the [RESISTE_HOME]/bin/ directory, the start-resiste.sh and start-resiste.bat files.

section.name: Logging
section.p: See the Logging page for more information about configuring logging.

section.name: SMTP Account
section.p: Resiste needs the SMTP information for your email provider. Each email provider is different so how you get this information is up to you.
In the [RESISTE_HOME]/conf/ directory, make a copy of email(example).properties as email.properties. Edit email.properties, adding your SMTP account details.
section.source: host=smtp.somewhere.org // Hostname of the SMTP server port=44 // Port of the SMTP server sslEnabled=true || false // Is SSL required, "true" or "false" username=someone // Your email account username password=password // Your email account clear-text password emailAddress=someone@somewhere.org // Your email address

section.name: RSS URLs
section.p: Resiste will handle any RSS URL you configure. In the [RESISTE_HOME]/conf/ directory, add your RSS URLs to rss_urls.csv.
This is a simple comma-separated data file. Here is an example:
ID can be any value you want, as long as it is unique. I suggest using an Online UUID Generator Tool to generate unique values. But they can also be as simple as 1,2,3,4.
URL is the URL of the RSS feed you want to keep track of. Typically, all you need to do is copy the link from your browser and paste it in.

section.name: RSS Email
section.p: Configure RSS email subject by editing, in the [RESISTE_HOME]/conf/ directory, the rss_email_subject.ftlt.
Configure RSS email body by editing, in the [RESISTE_HOME]/conf/ directory, the rss_email_body.ftlt.

section.name: Error Email
section.p: Configure error email subject by editing, in the [RESISTE_HOME]/conf/ directory, the error_email_subject.ftlt.
Configure error email body by editing, in the [RESISTE_HOME]/conf/ directory, the error_email_body.ftlt.
